p: It's highly likely that climate changes are contributing to the spread of the Aedes mosquitos that are carrying the Zika virus, a pathogen causing serious birth defects. As trusted and educated members of society, physicians, both individually and collectively, have critical roles to play. In addition to clinical management and prevention of Zika, physicians should communicate about the health benefits of addressing climate change in straightforward, evidence-based language to their local community and policymakers, and support for policies mitigating climate change.
